params.text:
Introduction

In the course you will assume the role of a staff member or volunteer working in a store, and a customer has come in with a donation. In the course we will explore:
Use the arrows to navigate the presentations

• What exactly Gift Aid is
  • The benefit of Gift Aid income for Barnardo’s
  • What is a 'little green card'
  • How to sign a customer up

• How to add a new Gift Aid donor to our Gift Aid database and pink print labels for the Gift Aided donations
  • How to process and print the Gift Aid barcodes for the donation
  • How to ensure you prevent any potential Gift Aid Fraud from taking place & how to report it correctly if you do suspect it

How it works

  • Watch video interactions with a customer in your store
  • Following each short video, you will be asked to select the most appropriate response.
• Possible responses are classified as:
Correct
Incorrect
Not the Best

• You can repeat this course numerous times for practice and to improve your responses.
  • This course has sound. Adjust your volume accordingly.
  • The course will take 30 minutes to complete.
  • Follow any on screen instructions
Click the         Proceed         button above to contuine

params.text: What is Gift Aid?

Gift Aid is a scheme for charities which means we can claim extra money back from HMRC. Barnardo’s can claim an extra 25p back for every £1 donated.

Its very important revenue stream and we encourage that all donctions big and small are Giftaided

We now know exactly what Gift Aid is - Let’s now see how:

  • It can drive extra income for our vital services
  • How we can help a customer who has just donated sign up for Gift Aid
Use the arrows to navigate the presentations

As Barnardo’s is a charity we can benefit from the Gift Aid scheme.

This means that Gift Aid can increase the overall value of a person’s donations by 25%. So they can give more to a cause they care about and ultimately as a charity we can generate more income for our vital services!

Below shows how items sold for £100 at a store if Gift aided would generate £125 worth of income for Barnardo’s.
We can see how Gift Aid is a really important income source - It is fantastic to know that for tax year 2021 - 2022 was £6,126,915.09

Now we are aware Gift Aid generates a lot of extra income for Barnardo’s, every year.

Imagine how much more money we could be claiming if we approached every single donor about signing up! Gift Aid can really help maximise our profits!
Barnardo’s would like to have 50% of our sales as gift aided sales
Customers & Gift Aid

Now we have a good understanding of what Gift Aid is and how it impacts the charity.

We need to see WHO is eligible to be a Gift Aider

Lets explain to the customer:

  • What gift aid is
  • How beneficial Gift Aid is to us as a charity
  • How someone can sign up
Who can be a Gift Aider?

A person is eligible to be a Gift Aider if they:

Are a UK tax payer – this includes:

  1. The person making the donation should be politely asked if they are either of the above when they are asked to sign up.
  2. A person who is a Pensioner or retired (who is paying tax on a private pension plan for example) they will still be eligible if they have paid enough tax during the year to cover the amount we are reclaiming on their donations.
Tax Information

A customer may ask if it matters how much tax they pay.

You can let a customer know:

  • The current basic rate of tax in the UK is 20%. If a person pay’s tax more than the basic rate, they can get some extra tax relief too. (However, THEY will have to claim it from HMRC).
  • If a customer also makes gift aided donations to other charities, they will be responsible for ensuring they pay the correct amount of tax to HMRC to cover these gift aided donations.
How to sign a customer up

Now we have a good understanding:

  • Exactly what gift aid is
  • How much extra income it can generate for the charity
  • Who can be a Gift Aider

Let’s look at how we can talk about Gift Aid to a customer in our store with a helpful interaction, step guide and some frequently asked questions answered!

params.text: Watch the following interaction

Step 1 - Make Conversation

A) When a customer donates ask the customer for their little green card

B) If they do not have a little green card, explain what Gift Aid is and how it helps Barnardo’s

C) If they would like to be a gift aider, give them a Gift Aid form or the Gift Aid tablet (if your store has one) to sign up

Step 2 - Fill out new donor Gift Aid form

Ask the customer if they require any help, you may need to assist the customer, however they should sign the paper form themselves or tablet themselves

If they do you may need to help them complete the form/or tablet

Remember the customer has to sign/date the form/tablet themselves

Step 3 - Enter the donor information onto Cybertil

How to enter the donor’s information onto Cybertill will be covered later in the training

Once they have completed and signed the Gift Aid form or all information onto the Gift Aid tablet – hand them their little green card!

Things to Remember

  • If the donor decides to take the form away OR does not want to enter their information onto the Gift Aid tablet, we cannot process their donation(s) as a Gift Aided donation
  • Their donation(s) would be processed as a NON Gift Aided donation in this instance
  • However, if the donor does complete the form or Gift Aid tablet in store when they have dropped of their donation – WE CAN PROCESS AS A GIFT AID DONATION!

Things to Remember Continued

  • Never pressure a donor to sign up as a Gift Aider, it is their decision whether they would like to
  • Just ensure you explain how important Gift Aid is as an extra income for Barnardo’s vital services
  • Please be friendly and helpful to all donors!

Why we need contact details & an email capture:

We need a contact address so that we can:

  • Send every Gift Aid donor a Gift Aid Tax statement yearly
  • Send a thank you for customers who have raise over £1,000 in sales

It costs a significant amount of money for Barnardo’s to send and post letters, so it is really important we capture the donor’s email address

By sending this thank you via email – this will save Barnardo’s a significant amount of money in postage costs
Barnardo’s spent over £100,000 in postage costs alone for letters sen out in 2021!

No Gift Aid is not just restricted to one charity, you can sign up to as many charities as you would like. We issue your own little green card at Barnardo’s that you just need to show every time you donate here!

Click Here to Continue

Gift Aid is a free scheme we operate for UK tax payers and won’t cost you a penny to sign up. The 25% comes out of your annual charitable tax relief. It allows us as a charity to claim back 25p per £1 of your donated items sold.

Click Here to Continue

Yes, we welcome all donations, small or large. All additional income will help us to continue to support even more vulnerable children, young people and adults! Every little bit makes a difference!

Click Here to Continue

It only takes two minutes. Or you can take one of our handy little green card leaflets home to learn about the scheme. The next time you donate simply bring along the complete form to receive your little green card!

Click Here to Continue

At Barnardo’s we follow GDPR guidelines and store all completed paper or electronic forms securely. We never sell or share customer information and will only contact you with your permission to tell you about in store events and offers.  We send a Tax Statement each year to all donors showing the amount raised for us.

Click Here to Continue

params.text: Processing a New Gift Aid Form

We have explained what Gift Aid is and the customer would like to be a Gift Aider

The first thing we need to do is get the customer to fill out the Gift Aid form, which can then be processed and put into our Gift Aider database.

Your store might also have a gift aid tablet which allows for a customer to electronically sign up. 

Lets explore how we process the Gift Aid Form (or tablet if your store has one)
Use the arrows to navigate the presentations

A customer can sign up to Gift Aid in 2 ways:

  • Using the in store tablet
  • Using the Physical Form

When the gift aid form is filled out the next step is to enter the customer details from the form onto Cybertill and issue a little green Gift Aid card

Make sure you have the Little Green Card ready as you will need the Card Number on it

First we need to add the customer to our Gift Aid Database

Press the 'Select / create customer' button on the Cybertill of the right
Step 1

The Customer Search box will appear

Press the 'Add New' button
Step 2

Time to enter the customers details (from the Gift Aid Form) onto the Cybertill.

Make sure you tick the Gift Aid Tick Box

Make sure you enter the number on the Little Green Card into the Card Number Box - this is very important as it links the account to the card!

Once your done press the 'ADD' button to add that customer to the Gift Aid Database
Step 3

GDPR

If using paper form to sign up new donors, all new completed and signed forms must be stored in a locked cabinet in the store immediately after completion.
Step 4

Hand the customer their little green card

Remind the customer that everytime they donate items to bring their little green Gift Aid card so their donation can be Gift Aided.

After handing the customer their card upon successfully entering onto the system the printed white till slip should be signed and dated ONLY by the member of staff entering, then attach to declaration form.

Back to the to Store

The customer now has their little Green Gift Aid card! Remind and encourage them to bring it every time they make a donation to the store!

Click the Proceed Button above to contuine

metadata.title: Gift Aid - Adding a new Gift Aider

params.text:
Processing a Donation with Gift Aid

Front of Store

The customer has returned and they have another donation bag! BUT this time they have their little green card!

Lets explore how we process there donation with Gift Aid
Use the arrows to navigate the presentations

We have a customer with a Little Green card.

This means we can process the Donation with Gift Aid using the Cybertill

First we need to find the customer in our Gift Aid Database

Press the 'Select / create customer' button
Step 1

The Customer Search Box will appear

Because they already exist in the system we need to find them in the database - Press the 'Loyalty text field'

TIP - If the donor doesn’t have their little green card you are able to search by their surname and postcode
Step 2
Step 3

Take the customers little green card - we need to use it to find their deatils in the Gift Aid Database. You can either scan the cards barcode OR type the cards number into the system.

TIP - Remember if the donor doesn’t have their little green card you are able to search by surname and postcode

Click on either methods to continue

Whether you input the card number manually OR scanned the cards barcode the system will find that customer in the Gift Aid database. 
 

Press the 'customers details' to select that customer
Step 4

With the customer selected press 'Account Options'

Note: The customers name on the interface
Step 5

This will show you the Account Options Menu - we want to print off a label for the donation, this indicates that the dontation is Gift Aided

Press the 'Gift Slips' button on the Cybertill
Step 6

Enter the number of donations that have been donated and Press 'OK'

ONLY PRINT THE PINK LABELS REQUIRED ANY LABELS NOT NEEDED MUST BE DESTROYED
Step 7
1
The Printer Dialog box will appear. Press 'Print'
Step 8
Step 9

params.text:
Take the pink labels you have printed and place them on the donation bag(s)

These pink labels are used to ensure:

  1. The donation(s) in the bag(s) are clearly a Gift Aided donation
  2. And that the next step of printing individual barcodes for the donation(s) can take place.

The next steps will be what you need to do at the back of the store to process the donation(s).

ONLY PRINT THE PINK LABELS REQUIRED

ANY LABELS NOT NEEDED MUST BE DESTROYED

Back to the to Store

The customer donation has been processed front of house with Gift Aid and is ready to be processed in the back of the store

Click the Proceed Button above to continue

params.text: Processing a donation with gift aid back of store

Finally we are going to process the donation and get that item out into the store

We will now look at how to print individual barcodes for each item donated by the gift aider
Use the arrows to navigate the presentations

We now have our donations!
 

The customer had a Gift Aid Green Card and we have processed that donation at the Cybertill. 
 

The donation has a Pink Label on it telling us that that item can be processed for Gift Aid. 
 

We will now look at processing the correct barcodes for the items at the back of the store
Proccsessing Gift Aid - Back of Store
Proccsessing Gift Aid - Back of Store Step 1

Whether its a single item or a bag of donation we process it in the same way

Item or bag of items has a pink label telling us it is a gift aided donation

Now we need to process back of store and print the correct barcodes for each item
Proccsessing Gift Aid - Back of Store Step 2
Open the donations one bag at a time and sort all items into departments
Proccsessing Gift Aid - Back of Store Step 3
On the computer Go to ‘donations’ (A)
Proccsessing Gift Aid - Back of Store Step 4
Go to ‘stock donations’  (B)
Proccsessing Gift Aid - Back of Store Step 5

Click on ‘account number’ (C)

Scan the pink lable barcode on the donation OR or enter the barcode number
Proccsessing Gift Aid - Back of Store Step 6

Enter a number for each item(s) that have been donated by the donor for each department

Once you have selected the correct amount click print and confirm the print
ONLY PRINT THE NUMBER OF LABELS REQUIRED!
Proccsessing Gift Aid - Back of Store Step 7
Click on the Print button to print out the gift aid donor labels.
ONLY PRINT THE NUMBER OF LABELS REQUIRED SHOULD BE BOLD OR HIGHLIGHTED

Proceed to put the printed barcode labels onto each individual item.

Remember you should only print the correct number of barcode labels for the amount of items donated by that particular donor.

Under no circumstances are unallocated gift aid labels to be used on other donations. This can amount to fraud! Please add destroy all unallocated labels.

And your done! Theses items are now ready to be put out into the shop
Proccsessing Gift Aid - Back of Store Step 8

If the Gift Aid process is intentionally not followed this can result in Barnardo’s making a claim to HMRC for the sales of gift aid donations which we were not entitled to do so. This is fraudulent as we would be claiming money that we are not entitled to.

This can occur by:

  • Claiming Gift Aid under incorrect donor ID’s.
  • Claiming too much Gift Aid under a donor ID

Processing Gift Aid incorrectly is very serious, even if the person did not intend to make any personal financial gain. As a Charity we have to ensure we fully adhere to the clear guidelines in place set by HMRC.
Gift Aid Fraud

1. Incorrectly or intentionally printing and putting a Gift aid barcode on a non-Gift aid item as this could result in Barnardo’s making a claim beyond the original gift aid donors’ person’s charitable tax allowance
  2. Finding unallocated barcode labels somewhere and putting these on non-gift aided donations.
  3. Bringing in donations from a street, commercial or educational fundraising activity where donations have been collected from numerous people from such an event. These donations can’t be processed under your personal Gift aid code as you have collected them on behalf of others. (Items from your own personal household that you previously owed, however would amount to your donations).
Examples of incorrect Gift Aid process:

• The Gift Aid Team runs frequent reports for all Gift Aided sales at every store and completes audits on all gift aided donations. This is to ensure compliance is adhered too at all times.
  • If you do suspect Gift Aid fraud is taking place please report directly to your Line Manager, the Gift Aid team or confidentiality through the Barnardo’s whistleblowing line.

All contacts can be found on the resources page at the start of this course

Please remember to ensure you always follow the correct gift aid procedures to prevent fraud.
Gift Aid Fraud Awarness & Prevention!

Everyone who works at a Barnardo’s store (including volunteers) can play their part in helping to generate extra income through the Gift Aid Scheme!

Whenever someone donates stock at the store, always ask the person if they are “one of our
little green cardholder’s?” in a friendly manner. As this is an unobtrusive conversation starter!

  • Do not be afraid to discuss the scheme with customers and donors, as the more awareness there is, means people are more likely to sign up!
  • If a customer says they are too busy to sign up during their visit, explain it only takes two minutes and really does benefit the charity with extra income for our vital services.
  • However if they really do not have time simply give them an A5 Booklet so that they can sign up when it is convenient for them to do so.
  • If you need to update donors account details please use the automated system on the Retail Hub
Gift Aid - Top tips with ALL customers

Course Completion

Great work, you now know:
o    What Gift Aid is
o    The beneficial impact Gift Aid has for Barnardo's
o    What a ‘little green Gift Aid’ card is
o    How to add a new customer to our Gift Aid Database
o    How to process a Gift Aid donation from a customer
Click the Proceed Button above to Complete the Course
